page.title: 07Farming contd.Newton/Dunham
page.content: Farming Changes- Since the beginning of World War 2 farming has changed greatly. Land drainage has altered the balance of farming .Fields now drained are better suited to crop production than to cattle production.Most farms are still family concerns of average size _200 to 500 acres. Mixed farming is still popular and a variety of crops are grown. Recently intensive factory farming has evolved with two such farmers in the area growing vast acreages of high value crops such as potatoes and oil seed rape on rented and their own land. These farms have rapidly grown. Another change has resulted from the increased dependence on machinery and a decreased need for manual labour. Before 1940 a farm employing 10 men now employs only 2.The result is cost effective production but loss of village life.
